sgis.vector_tools package#

Module contents#

A small intro to vector_tools

sgis.vector_tools.add_ID(layer, prefix='', field_length=11)#

Add a numerical ID as a new field to a layer.

This ID can be prefixed with a given string.

Parameters:

  • layer (QgsVectorLayer) â€“ Layer to process.

  • prefix (str, optional) â€“ Common part of all features ID, at the beginning of the ID.

  • field_length (int, optional) â€“ Number of , by default 11

Returns:

Shallow copy of layer with an additionnal â€˜IDâ€™ field.

Return type:

QgsVectorLayer

Notes

ID is computed as: ID = concatenation(prefix, id-1) where â€˜idâ€™ is the Qgis id of the feature. Thus:

  • ID start from 0.

  • The new field is of type str.

sgis.vector_tools.add_XY_coordinates(layer)#

Add to a layer 2 new fields for the (X, Y) coordinates.

Parameters:

layer (QgsVectorLayer) â€“ Layer to process.

Returns:

Shallow copy of layer with two new fields: â€˜Xâ€™ and â€˜Yâ€™

Return type:

QgsVectorLayer

Notes

  • â€˜Xâ€™ and â€˜Yâ€™ field are of type float.

  • Precision is one decimal

sgis.vector_tools.add_buffer_distance(layer, distance=4)#

Increase the area of every feature of a layer by adding a buffer distance.

Parameters:

  • layer (QgsVectorLayer) â€“ Layer to process.

  • distance (float, optional) â€“ Distance, in meters.

Returns:

Copy of layer with modified feature geometries

Return type:

QgsVectorLayer

sgis.vector_tools.add_protected_buildings(layer, layer_protected_buildings)#

Quite specific to the French case. Add a boolean attribute, for every building of a vector layer, that states whether this building is included in an architectural protected area.

Parameters:

  • layer (QgsVectorLayer) â€“ Layer to process.

  • layer_protected_buildings (QgsVectorLayer) â€“ Vector layer whose features correspond to protected areas. This layer must be downloaded at http://atlas.patrimoines.culture.fr/atlas/trunk/.

Returns:

Original layer with a new â€˜protectedâ€™ boolean attribute that describes whether a building lies in a protected area.

Return type:

QgsVectorLayer

Notes

  1. This method must be called before merge_overlapped_buildings.

  2. The algorithm proceeds this way:

    1. Both vector files are loaded.

    2. Spatial intersection is performed.

    3. Buildings for which this intersection is not empty get â€˜protected=Trueâ€™, other buildings get â€˜protected=Falseâ€™.

    4. Useless fields (generated by the intersection) are removed.

sgis.vector_tools.add_roof_type(layer, roof_data_path)#

Quite specific to the French case. Add to a building vector layer a â€˜toitureâ€™ attribute that describes the most-likely roof type (material, color) of the building.

The assigned roof type of building â€˜kâ€™ is the dominant roof type among the buildings of the village of building â€˜kâ€™.

Parameters:

  • layer (QgsVectorLayer) â€“

    The layer to process. Every feature is a building. Must have the following attributes:

    • â€™IDâ€™: str, identifier of the building

    • â€™communeâ€™: str, post-code of the village of the building

  • roof_data_path (path-like) â€“

    CSV file containing the roof type information. Every feature is a building. Must have the following attributes (columns):

    • â€™batiment_groupe_idâ€™: str

    • â€™mat_toit_txtâ€™: str

    The post-code is read as the first 5 characters of â€˜batiment_groupe_idâ€™, and compared to the â€˜communeâ€™ attribute of layer.

Returns:

The share of each roof type in roof_data_path, independantly from the commune. For informational purpose only.

Return type:

pandas.Series

Notes

  1. The roof type dataset (roof_data_path) is an information produced by the Base de DonnÃ©es Nationale des BÃ¢timents (BDNB). It can be downloaded at https://www.data.gouv.fr/en/datasets/base-de-donnees-nationale-des-batiments/. The downloaded files include many other datasets. The roof type information is stored as CSV files (â€˜batiment_groupe_ffo_bat_[â€¦].csvâ€™) and can be processed department per department:

  2. Regarding the roof type dataset:

    • Not all buildings and communes are described

    • Whenever an entire commune or the â€˜mat_toit_txtâ€™ field for a building is missing, the â€˜UNKNOWNâ€™ string is used as the roof-type.

  3. The reason not to assign the roof type to each building of layer is a lack of a common building identifier for layer (cadastre data) and roof types (BDNB data).

  4. The layer is modified in-place, i.e. no copy is returned.

sgis.vector_tools.clean_processing_folder()#

Delete the content of the Qgis processing temporary folder. Use with caution.

sgis.vector_tools.copy_layer(layer, name=None)#

Copy a layer in memory.

Parameters:

  • layer (QgsVectorLayer) â€“ Layer to copy. The geomtry type must be â€˜Polygonâ€™.

  • name (str, optional) â€“ Name of the copy. If None, name is the name of layer appended with â€˜_copyâ€™.

Returns:

Copied layer

Return type:

QgsVectorLayer

sgis.vector_tools.export_csv(layer, full_path)#

Write the attribute table of a vector layer in a CSV file.

Parameters:

  • layer (QgsVectorLayer) â€“ Layer whose attributes must be exported.

  • full_path (path-like) â€“ Path of the CSV file.

Raises:

AttributeError â€“ If full_path is not a path to a CSV file.

sgis.vector_tools.export_shp(layer, path, name)#

Export a vector layer as an SHP file.

Parameters:

  • layer (QgsVectorLayer) â€“ Layer to export

  • path (path-like) â€“ Path of the directory to which SHP file is exported.

  • name (str) â€“ Name of the exported SHP file.

Raises:

AttributeError â€“ If path is not a directory.

sgis.vector_tools.load_layer(full_path, layer_name)#

Load a vector layer.

Parameters:

  • full_path (path-like) â€“ Path of the SHP layer to load.

  • layer_name (str) â€“ Name of the loaded layer.

Returns:

Layer at full_path.

Return type:

QgsVectorLayer

Raises:

ValueError â€“ Whenever Qgis loading of the layer fails.

Notes

Modifications of the layer may propagate to the original file on disk.

sgis.vector_tools.merge_overlapped_buildings(layer, reference_field_name='Score')#

Merge every couple of features whose geometries intersect.

Parameters:

  • layer (QgsVectorLayer) â€“ Layer to process. The geometry type must be â€˜Polygonâ€™.

  • reference_field_name (str, optional) â€“ Numerical attribute of layer used as a criteria for the merge operation. The attributes of the resulting feature are the one of the feature having the higher value for reference_field_name. By default â€˜Scoreâ€™

Notes

The layer is modified in-place, i.e. no copy is returned. If feature A intersects feature B, and B intersects C then the resulting merged feature includes all of A, B and C geometries. Same for n > 3 intersections.

sgis.vector_tools.remove_small_features(layer, min_area=10)#

Delete every feature whose area is smaller than a given threshold.

Parameters:

  • layer (QgsVectorLayer) â€“ Layer to process.

  • min_area (float, optional) â€“ Feature whose area is smaller than this will be deleted.

Returns:

Copy of layer with some deleted features.

Return type:

QgsVectorLayer

sgis.vector_tools.update_on_ID(layer, dataframe)#

Add the data of a DataFrame to the attribute table of a vector layer.

Columns of the DataFrame become attributes of the layer.

Parameters:

  • layer (QgsVectorLayer) â€“ Layer to process. Must have an â€˜IDâ€™ attribute that corresponds to the index of dataframe.

  • dataframe (pandas.DataFrame) â€“ Index of DataFrame must be the ID of the building, with a str dtype.

Raises:

NotImplementedError â€“ If dtype of one column in dataframe is not float, int or string.

Notes

Regarding missing elements:

  • If some features are in the layer but not in the DataFrame: they are not updated.

  • If some features are in the DataFrame but not in the layer: they are ignored.

dataframe is not modified by these operations.
